channel.title: Comments on: AngularJS vs Knockout – Validation (3 of 8)
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Lusgon
item.dc:creator: Lusgon
item.description: Is possible to track the validation state with knockout-validation with some work around ko.validation.group. One only has to create a field name attribute to present a human readable value. The hard part, when is really needed to dive into knockout-validation, is when you start mixing sync and async validations...
item.content:encoded: Is possible to track the validation state with knockout-validation with some work around ko.validation.group. One only has to create a field name attribute to present a human readable value. The hard part, when is really needed to dive into knockout-validation, is when you start mixing sync and async validations…

item.title: By: tonyf
item.dc:creator: tonyf
item.description: I couldn't agree more on your analysis. Validation is a Model and ViewModel level concern that the View should only present, not store the state and logic for. Great breakdown and comparison. Loving this series so far!
item.content:encoded: I couldn’t agree more on your analysis. Validation is a Model and ViewModel level concern that the View should only present, not store the state and logic for. Great breakdown and comparison. Loving this series so far!

item.title: By: damber
item.dc:creator: damber
item.description: Great work Eli, I'm finding this a very useful series - looking forward to the rest.
item.content:encoded: Great work Eli, I’m finding this a very useful series – looking forward to the rest.
